first_para: Nigel Huddleston is a British Conservative Party politician. He is the Industry Head of Travel for Google and is the Conservative Prospective Parliamentary Candidate for Mid Worcestershire. He was selected as a candidate after a primary election in which anyone on the constituency's electoral register was eligible to vote. The constituency association did not publish the votes that each candidate received. He was selected after Peter Luff announced he would not stand at the 2015 election.

full.extract:
Nigel Huddleston is a British Conservative Party politician. He is the Industry Head of Travel for Google and is the Conservative Prospective Parliamentary Candidate for Mid Worcestershire. He was selected as a candidate after a primary election in which anyone on the constituency's electoral register was eligible to vote. The constituency association did not publish the votes that each candidate received. He was selected after Peter Luff announced he would not stand at the 2015 election.
In 2010 he was the Conservative candidate for Luton South, and lost by 2,329 votes to Labour's Gavin Shuker.
full.title: Nigel Huddleston
